top_categories.workout_context: Ouray Gravel Grinder's mixed terrain forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 80 miles.
At mile 60 of 80, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Ouray Gravel Grinder's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before September.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 80 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
98ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Ouray Gravel Grinder, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
7,800ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Ouray Gravel Grinder. Train it until it feels boring.
7,800ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Ouray Gravel Grinder, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
The aerobic base that lets you ride mixed terrain at tempo for 80 miles without cracking. No shortcuts.
Smooth pedaling at 80 miles saves muscle. Bad technique at mile 10 is invisible. At mile 80 it's a cramp.

race_overlay.heat: September in Ouray, Colorado. Begin heat acclimatization 10–14 days before Ouray Gravel Grinder — 20–30min sauna sessions or midday rides in full kit. Pre-load sodium 48 hours out. Target 500–750ml/hr with electrolytes on race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Ouray Gravel Grinder’s 80 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Ouray Gravel Grinder with 7,800ft of climbing, much of it above 8,000ft demands altitude preparation. Arrive 5–7 days early for acclimatization. Expect 5–15% power reduction at altitude. Increase iron intake 4 weeks out. Hydrate aggressively — altitude increases fluid loss by 20–40%.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Ouray Gravel Grinder demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride mixed terrain at race-day cadence weekly. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 80 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Durability, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 80 miles of mixed terrain in Ouray, Colorado.
